verses.verse: Then Naomi <S%H5281><s%> her mother in law <S%H2545><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto her, My daughter <S%H1323><s%>, shall I not seek <S%H1245><s%> rest <S%H4494><s%> for thee, that it may be well <S%H3190><s%> with thee?

And now is not Boaz <S%H1162><s%> of our kindred <S%H4130><s%>, with whose maidens <S%H5291><s%> thou wast? Behold, he winnoweth <S%H2219><s%> barley <S%H8184><s%> to night <S%H3915><s%> in the threshingfloor <S%H1637><s%>.

Wash <S%H7364><s%> thyself therefore, and anoint <S%H5480><s%> thee, and put <S%H7760><s%> thy raiment <S%H8071><s%> upon thee, and get thee down <S%H3381><s%> to the floor <S%H1637><s%>: but make not thyself known <S%H3045><s%> unto the man <S%H376><s%>, until he shall have done <S%H3615><s%> eating <S%H398><s%> and drinking <S%H8354><s%>.

And it shall be, when he lieth down <S%H7901><s%>, that thou shalt mark <S%H3045><s%> the place <S%H4725><s%> where he shall lie <S%H7901><s%>, and thou shalt go in <S%H935><s%>, and uncover <S%H1540><s%> his feet <S%H4772><s%>, and lay thee down <S%H7901><s%>; and he will tell <S%H5046><s%> thee what thou shalt do <S%H6213><s%>.
And she said <S%H559><s%> unto her, All that thou sayest <S%H559><s%> unto me I will do <S%H6213><s%>.
¶ And she went down <S%H3381><s%> unto the floor <S%H1637><s%>, and did <S%H6213><s%> according to all that her mother in law <S%H2545><s%> bade <S%H6680><s%> her.

And when Boaz <S%H1162><s%> had eaten <S%H398><s%> and drunk <S%H8354><s%>, and his heart <S%H3820><s%> was merry <S%H3190><s%>, he went <S%H935><s%> to lie down <S%H7901><s%> at the end <S%H7097><s%> of the heap of corn <S%H6194><s%>: and she came <S%H935><s%> softly <S%H3909><s%>, and uncovered <S%H1540><s%> his feet <S%H4772><s%>, and laid her down <S%H7901><s%>.

¶ And it came to pass at midnight <S%H2677><s%> <S%H3915><s%>, that the man <S%H376><s%> was afraid <S%H2729><s%>, and turned <S%H3943><s%> himself: and, behold, a woman <S%H802><s%> lay <S%H7901><s%> at his feet <S%H4772><s%>.

And he said <S%H559><s%>, Who art thou? And she answered <S%H559><s%>, I am Ruth <S%H7327><s%> thine handmaid <S%H519><s%>: spread <S%H6566><s%> therefore thy skirt <S%H3671><s%> over thine handmaid <S%H519><s%>; for thou art a near kinsman <S%H1350><s%>.

And he said <S%H559><s%>, Blessed <S%H1288><s%> be thou of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, my daughter <S%H1323><s%>: for thou hast shewed <S%H3190><s%> more kindness <S%H2617><s%> in the latter end <S%H314><s%> than at the beginning <S%H7223><s%>, inasmuch as thou followedst <S%H3212><s%> <S%H310><s%> not <S%H1115><s%> young men <S%H970><s%>, whether poor <S%H1800><s%> or rich <S%H6223><s%>.

And now, my daughter <S%H1323><s%>, fear <S%H3372><s%> not; I will do <S%H6213><s%> to thee all that thou requirest <S%H559><s%>: for all the city <S%H8179><s%> of my people <S%H5971><s%> doth know <S%H3045><s%> that thou art a virtuous <S%H2428><s%> woman <S%H802><s%>.
And now it is true <S%H551><s%> that I am thy near kinsman <S%H1350><s%>: howbeit there is <S%H3426><s%> a kinsman <S%H1350><s%> nearer <S%H7138><s%> than I.

Tarry <S%H3885><s%> this night <S%H3915><s%>, and it shall be in the morning <S%H1242><s%>, that if he will perform unto thee the part of a kinsman <S%H1350><s%>, well <S%H2896><s%>; let him do the kinsman's part <S%H1350><s%>: but if he will <S%H2654><s%> not do the part of a kinsman <S%H1350><s%> to thee, then will I do the part of a kinsman <S%H1350><s%> to thee, as the LORD <S%H3068><s%> liveth <S%H2416><s%>: lie down <S%H7901><s%> until the morning <S%H1242><s%>.

¶ And she lay <S%H7901><s%> at his feet <S%H4772><s%> until the morning <S%H1242><s%>: and she rose up <S%H6965><s%> before <S%H2958><s%> one <S%H376><s%> could know <S%H5234><s%> another <S%H7453><s%>. And he said <S%H559><s%>, Let it not be known <S%H3045><s%> that a woman <S%H802><s%> came <S%H935><s%> into the floor <S%H1637><s%>.

Also he said <S%H559><s%>, Bring <S%H3051><s%> the vail <S%H4304><s%> that thou hast upon thee, and hold <S%H270><s%> it. And when she held <S%H270><s%> it, he measured <S%H4058><s%> six <S%H8337><s%> measures of barley <S%H8184><s%>, and laid <S%H7896><s%> it on her: and she went <S%H935><s%> into the city <S%H5892><s%>.

And when she came <S%H935><s%> to her mother in law <S%H2545><s%>, she said <S%H559><s%>, Who art thou, my daughter <S%H1323><s%>? And she told <S%H5046><s%> her all that the man <S%H376><s%> had done <S%H6213><s%> to her.

And she said <S%H559><s%>, These six <S%H8337><s%> measures of barley <S%H8184><s%> gave <S%H5414><s%> he me; for he said <S%H559><s%> to me, Go <S%H935><s%> not empty <S%H7387><s%> unto thy mother in law <S%H2545><s%>.

Then said <S%H559><s%> she, Sit still <S%H3427><s%>, my daughter <S%H1323><s%>, until thou know <S%H3045><s%> how the matter <S%H1697><s%> will fall <S%H5307><s%>: for the man <S%H376><s%> will not be in rest <S%H8252><s%>, until <S%H518><s%> he have finished <S%H3615><s%> the thing <S%H1697><s%> this day <S%H3117><s%>.
